info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 08 at 8:04PM MDT until August 08 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM MDT FOR NORTHEASTERN KIT CARSON COUNTY... At 804 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 10 miles north of Burlington, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Burlington. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 432 and 450. Highway 385 between mile markers 181 and 206, and near mile marker 211. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
